{"step_by_step_thinking": "Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome (SSSS) is caused by the exfoliative toxins produced by Staphylococcus aureus. These toxins are released into the bloodstream and cause widespread epidermal damage. The primary defense against these toxins is the production of neutralizing antibodies. The immunoglobulin that is primarily responsible for the secondary immune response and has the ability to cross the placenta to provide passive immunity to the fetus is IgG. Therefore, IgG is the immunoglobulin involved in the primary defense against the bacteria and toxins produced in SSSS.", "answer_choice": "A"}
